offers.description: List all proposals that are being listed as offers.

requests.description: List all proposals that are being listed as requests.

myAgent.description: Loads details of the currently authenticated REA agent

agent.description: Find an agent (person or organization) by their ID

agents.description: Loads all agents publicly registered within this collaboration space

organization.description: Find an organization (group) agent by its ID

organizations.description: Loads all organizations publicly registered within this collaboration space

person.description: Find a person by their ID

people.description: Loads all people who have publicly registered with this collaboration space.

agentRelationship.description: Retrieve details of an agent relationship by its ID

agentRelationships.description: Retrieve details of all the relationships between all agents registered in this collaboration space

agentRelationshipRole.description: Retrieve details of an agent relationship role by its ID

agentRelationshipRoles.description: Retrieve all possible kinds of associations that agents may have with one another in this collaboration space

createEconomicEvent.description: Registers a new (`EconomicEvent`) with the collaboration space. Also serves as a means to register (`EconomicResource`) as well, instead of createEconomicResource

createPerson.description: Registers a new (human) person with the collaboration space

deletePerson.description: Erase record of a person and thus remove them from the collaboration space

createOrganization.description: Registers a new organization (group agent) with the collaboration space

deleteOrganization.description: Erase record of an organization and thus remove it from the collaboration space

fulfilledBy.description: The economic event which completely or partially fulfills a commitment.

fulfills.description: The commitment which is completely or partially fulfilled by an economic event.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

Fulfillment.description: Represents many-to-many relationships between commitments and economic events that fully or partially satisfy one or more commitments.

ID.title: ID
ID.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

String.title: String
String.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fulfilledBy.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event which completely or partially fulfills a commitment.

fulfills.description: (`Commitment`) The commitment which is completely or partially fulfilled by an economic event.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

fulfilledBy.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event which completely or partially fulfills a commitment.

fulfills.description: (`Commitment`) The commitment which is completely or partially fulfilled by an economic event.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

Int.title: Int
Int.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

appreciationOf.description: The economic event this appreciation has been given in acknowledgement of.

appreciationWith.description: The economic event provided as a gift in this appreciation.

Appreciation.description:
A way to tie an economic event that is given in loose fulfilment for another economic event, without commitments or expectations.
Supports the gift economy.

appreciationOf.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event this appreciation has been given in acknowledgement of.

appreciationWith.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event provided as a gift in this appreciation.

appreciationOf.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event this appreciation has been given in acknowledgement of.

appreciationWith.description: (`EconomicEvent`) The economic event provided as a gift in this appreciation.

action.description: Relates a commitment to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

resourceInventoriedAs.description: Exact economic resource involved in the commitment.

toResourceInventoriedAs.description: Additional economic resource on the commitment when needed by the receiver. Used when a transfer or move, or sometimes other actions, requires explicitly identifying an economic resource on the receiving side.

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the commitment.

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the commitment.

hasPointInTime.description: The planned date/time for the commitment. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

due.description: The time something is expected to be complete.

created.description: The creation time of the commitment.

finished.description: The commitment is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this commitment.

deletable.description: The commitment can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

stage.description: References the ProcessSpecification of the last process the economic resource went through. Stage is used when the last process is important for finding proper resources, such as where the publishing process wants only documents that have gone through the editing process.

clauseOf.description: This commitment is part of the exchange agreement.

provider.description: The economic agent from whom the commitment is initiated.

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the commitment is for.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

satisfies.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

independentDemandOf.description: Represents a desired deliverable expected from this plan.

plannedWithin.description: The transfer commitment is part of the plan.

inputOf.description: Defines the process to which this commitment is an input.

outputOf.description: Defines the process for which this commitment is an output.

atLocation.description: The place where a commitment occurs. Usually mappable.

fulfilledBy.description: The economic event which completely or partially fulfills a commitment.

resourceConformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

Commitment.description: A planned economic flow that has been promised by an agent to another agent.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an intent. Does not imply uniqueness.

action.description: Relates an intent to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried. This is the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource, depending on the type of resource and resource effect of action.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

resourceInventoriedAs.description: When a specific `EconomicResource` is known which can service the `Intent`, this defines that resource.

toResourceInventoriedAs.description: Additional economic resource on the intent when needed by the receiver. Used when a transfer or move, or sometimes other actions, requires explicitly identifying an economic resource on the receiving side.

availableQuantity.description: The total quantity of the offered resource available.

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the intent.

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the intent.

hasPointInTime.description: The planned date/time for the intent. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

due.description: The time something is expected to be complete.

finished.description: The intent is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the intent, such as a photo.

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the intent.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this intent.

deletable.description: The intent can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

provider.description: The economic agent from whom the intent is initiated. This implies that the intent is an offer.

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the intent is for.  This implies that the intent is a request.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

inputOf.description: Defines the process to which this intent is an input.

outputOf.description: Defines the process to which this intent is an output.

resourceConformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

atLocation.description: The place where an intent would occur. Usually mappable.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for the process. Does not imply uniqueness.
An informal or formal textual identifier for the process. Does not imply uniqueness.
An informal or formal textual identifier for the process. Does not imply uniqueness.

action.description: Relates an economic event to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

resourceInventoriedAs.description: Economic resource involved in the economic event.

toResourceInventoriedAs.description: Additional economic resource on the economic event when needed by the receiver. Used when a transfer or move, or sometimes other actions, requires explicitly identifying an economic resource on the receiving side.

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried. This is the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource, depending on the type of resource and resource effect of action.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning of the economic event.

hasEnd.description: The end of the economic event.

hasPointInTime.description: The date/time at which the economic event occurred. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this economic event.

triggeredBy.description: References another economic event that implied this economic event, often based on a prior agreement.

deletable.description: The economic event can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

triggers.description: Other EconomicEvents which have been triggered by this one.

provider.description: The economic agent from whom the actual economic event is initiated.

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the actual economic event is for.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

realizationOf.description: This economic event occurs as part of this agreement.

inputOf.description: Defines the process to which this event is an input.

outputOf.description: Defines the process for which this event is an output.

atLocation.description: The place where an economic event occurs.  Usually mappable.

toLocation.description: The new location of the receiver resource.

resourceConformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

satisfies.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

EconomicEvent.description: An observed economic flow, as opposed to a flow planned to happen in the future. This could reflect a change in the quantity of an economic resource. It is also defined by its behavior in relation to the economic resource (see `Action`)

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an item. Does not imply uniqueness.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

trackingIdentifier.description: Sometimes called serial number, used when each item must have a traceable identifier (like a computer). Could also be used for other unique tracking identifiers needed for resources.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the resource, such as a photo, diagram, etc.

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the resource.

accountingQuantity.description: The current amount and unit of the economic resource for which the agent has primary rights and responsibilities, sometimes thought of as ownership. This can be either stored or derived from economic events affecting the resource.

onhandQuantity.description: The current amount and unit of the economic resource which is under direct control of the agent.  It may be more or less than the accounting quantity. This can be either stored or derived from economic events affecting the resource.

unitOfEffort.description: The unit used for use or work or cite actions for this resource.

state.description: The state of the desired economic resource (pass or fail), after coming out of a test or review process. Can be derived from the last event if a pass or fail event.

containedIn.description: Used when a stock economic resource contains items also defined as economic resources.

custodian.description: Agent who has physical custody of the resource.

contains.description: Used when a stock economic resource contains units also defined as economic resources.

economicEventsInOutFrom.description: All economic events with the economic resource in the resourceInventoriedAs, including all process related events, the provider resource in transfers/moves, and raise/lower.

economicEventsTo.description: All economic events with the economic Resource in the toResourceInventoriedAs, which is the receiver resource in transfers and moves.

primaryAccountable.description: The agent currently with primary rights and responsibilites for the economic resource. It is the agent that is associated with the accountingQuantity of the economic resource.

lot.description: Lot or batch of an economic resource, used to track forward or backwards to all occurrences of resources of that lot. Note more than one resource can be of the same lot.

stage.description: References the ProcessSpecification of the last process the desired economic resource went through. Stage is used when the last process is important for finding proper resources, such as where the publishing process wants only documents that have gone through the editing process.

currentLocation.description: The current place an economic resource is located. Could be at any level of granularity, from a town to an address to a warehouse location. Usually mappable.

conformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

EconomicResource.description: A resource which is useful to people or the ecosystem.

action.description: (`Action`) Relates an economic event to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

resourceInventoriedAs.description: (`EconomicResource`) Economic resource involved in the economic event.

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried. This is the quantity that could be used to increment or decrement a resource, depending on the type of resource and resource effect of action.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning of the economic event.

hasEnd.description: The end of the economic event.

hasPointInTime.description: The date/time at which the economic event occurred. Can be used instead of beginning and end.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this economic event.

triggeredBy.description: (`EconomicEvent`) References another economic event that implied this economic event, often based on a prior agreement.

toResourceInventoriedAs.description: (`EconomicResource`) Additional economic resource on the economic event when needed by the receiver. Used when a transfer or move, or sometimes other actions, requires explicitly identifying an economic resource on the receiving side.

provider.description: (`Agent`) The economic agent from whom the actual economic event is initiated.

receiver.description: (`Agent`) The economic agent whom the actual economic event is for.

realizationOf.description: (`Agreement`) This economic event occurs as part of this agreement.

inputOf.description: (`Process`) Defines the process to which this event is an input.

outputOf.description: (`Process`) Defines the process for which this event is an output.

atLocation.description: (`SpatialThing`) The place where an economic event occurs.  Usually mappable.

toLocation.description: (`SpatialThing`) The new location of the receiver resource.

resourceConformsTo.description: (`ResourceSpecification`) The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this economic event.

triggeredBy.description: (`EconomicEvent`) References another economic event that implied this economic event, often based on a prior agreement.

realizationOf.description: (`Agreement`) This economic event occurs as part of this agreement.

economicEvent.description: Details of the newly created event.

economicResource.description: Details of any newly created `EconomicResource`, for events that create new resources.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an item. Does not imply uniqueness.

trackingIdentifier.description: Sometimes called serial number, used when each item must have a traceable identifier (like a computer). Could also be used for other unique tracking identifiers needed for resources.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the resource, such as a photo, diagram, etc.

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the resource.

containedIn.description: (`EconomicResource`) Used when a stock economic resource contains items also defined as economic resources.

lot.description: (`ProductBatch`) Lot or batch of an economic resource, used to track forward or backwards to all occurrences of resources of that lot. Note more than one resource can be of the same lot.

currentLocation.description: (`SpatialThing`) The current place an economic resource is located.  Could be at any level of granularity, from a town to an address to a warehouse location.  Usually mappable.

conformsTo.description: (`ResourceSpecification`) The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

EconomicResourceCreateParams.description: Input `EconomicResource` type used when sending events to setup initial resource recordings

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the resource, such as a photo, diagram, etc.

imageList.description: URI addresses to images relevant to the resource.

containedIn.description: (`EconomicResource`) Used when a stock economic resource contains items also defined as economic resources.

unitOfEffort.description: (`Unit`) The unit used for use or work or cite actions for this resource.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning date/time of the scenario, often the beginning of an accounting period.

hasEnd.description: The ending date/time of the scenario, often the end of an accounting period.

definedAs.description: The scenario definition for this scenario, for example yearly budget.

refinementOf.description: This scenario refines another scenario, often as time moves closer or for more detail.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

Scenario.description: An estimated or analytical logical collection of higher level processes used for budgeting, analysis, plan refinement, etc.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario definition. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasDuration.description: The duration of the scenario, often an accounting period.

ScenarioDefinition.description: The type definition of one or more scenarios, such as Yearly Budget.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario. Does not imply uniqueness.

definedAs.description: (`ScenarioDefinition`) The scenario definition for this scenario, for example yearly budget.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning date/time of the scenario, often the beginning of an accounting period.

hasEnd.description: The ending date/time of the scenario, often the end of an accounting period.

refinementOf.description: (`Scenario`) This scenario refines another scenario, often as time moves closer or for more detail.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario. Does not imply uniqueness.

definedAs.description: (`ScenarioDefinition`) The scenario definition for this scenario, for example yearly budget.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning date/time of the scenario, often the beginning of an accounting period.

hasEnd.description: The ending date/time of the scenario, often the end of an accounting period.

refinementOf.description: (`Scenario`) This scenario refines another scenario, often as time moves closer or for more detail.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario definition. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasDuration.description: The duration of the scenario, often an accounting period.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a scenario definition. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasDuration.description: The duration of the scenario, often an accounting period.

TimeUnit.description: Defines the unit of time measured in a temporal `Duration`.

numericDuration.description: A number representing the duration, will be paired with a unit.

Duration.description: A `Duration` represents an interval between two `DateTime` values.

numericDuration.description: A number representing the duration, will be paired with a unit.

IDuration.description: Mutation input structure for defining time durations.

label.description: A human readable label for the unit, can be language specific.

symbol.description: A standard display symbol for a unit of measure.

Unit.description:
Defines a unit of measurement, along with its display symbol.
From OM2 vocabulary.

hasNumericalValue.description: A number representing the quantity, will be paired with a unit.

Measure.description:
Semantic meaning for measurements: binds a quantity to its measurement unit.
See http://www.qudt.org/pages/QUDToverviewPage.html

hasNumericalValue.description: A number representing the quantity, will be paired with a unit.

IMeasure.description: Mutation input structure for defining measurements. Should be nulled if not present, rather than empty.

label.description: A human readable label for the unit, can be language specific.

symbol.description: A standard display symbol for a unit of measure.

label.description: A human readable label for the unit, can be language specific.

symbol.description: A standard display symbol for a unit of measure.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a process. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the process.

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the process.

finished.description: The process is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

deletable.description: The process can be safely deleted, has no dependent information.

basedOn.description: The definition or specification for a process.

nestedIn.description: The process with its inputs and outputs is part of the scenario.

plannedWithin.description: The process with its inputs and outputs is part of the plan.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

Process.description: An activity that changes inputs into outputs.  It could transform or transport economic resource(s).

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a process. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the process.

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the process.

finished.description: The process is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

basedOn.description: (`ProcessSpecification`) The definition or specification for a process.

plannedWithin.description: (`Plan`) The process with its inputs and outputs is part of the plan.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a process. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The planned beginning of the process.

hasEnd.description: The planned end of the process.

finished.description: The process is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

basedOn.description: (`ProcessSpecification`) The definition or specification for a process.

plannedWithin.description: (`Plan`) The process with its inputs and outputs is part of the plan.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

batchNumber.description: The standard unique identifier of the batch.

expiryDate.description: Expiration date of the batch, commonly used for food.

productionDate.description: Date the batch was produced.  Can be derived from the economic event of production.

ProductBatch.description:
A lot or batch, defining a resource produced at the same time in the same way.
From DataFoodConsortium vocabulary https://datafoodconsortium.gitbook.io/dfc-standard-documentation/.

batchNumber.description: The standard unique identifier of the batch.

expiryDate.description: Expiration date of the batch, commonly used for food.

productionDate.description: Date the batch was produced.  Can be derived from the economic event of production.

batchNumber.description: The standard unique identifier of the batch.

expiryDate.description: Expiration date of the batch, commonly used for food.

productionDate.description: Date the batch was produced.  Can be derived from the economic event of production.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a proposal. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning time of proposal publication.

hasEnd.description: The end time of proposal publication.

unitBased.description: This proposal contains unit based quantities, which can be multiplied to create commitments; commonly seen in a price list or e-commerce.

created.description: The date and time the proposal was created.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

eligibleLocation.description: Location or area where the proposal is valid.

Proposal.description: Published requests or offers, sometimes with what is expected in return.

reciprocal.description: This is a reciprocal intent of this proposal, not primary. Not meant to be used for intent matching.

publishedIn.description: The published proposal which this intent is part of.

publishes.description: The intent which is part of this published proposal.

ProposedIntent.description: Represents many-to-many relationships between Proposals and Intents, supporting including intents in multiple proposals, as well as a proposal including multiple intents.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a proposal. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning time of proposal publication.

hasEnd.description: The end time of proposal publication.

unitBased.description: This proposal contains unit based quantities, which can be multipied to create commitments; commonly seen in a price list or e-commerce.

created.description: The date and time the proposal was created.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

eligibleLocation.description: (`SpatialThing`) The location at which this proposal is eligible.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for a proposal. Does not imply uniqueness.

hasBeginning.description: The beginning date/time of proposal publication.

hasEnd.description: The end time of proposal publication.

unitBased.description: This proposal contains unit based quantities, which can be multipied to create commitments; commonly seen in a price list or e-commerce.

inScopeOf.description: (`AccountingScope`) Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

eligibleLocation.description: (`SpatialThing`) The location at which this proposal is eligible.

satisfies.description: An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

satisfiedBy.description: A commitment or economic event fully or partially satisfying an intent.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

Satisfaction.description: Represents many-to-many relationships between intents and commitments or events that partially or full satisfy one or more intents.

satisfies.description: (`Intent`) An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

satisfiedBy.description: (`Commitment`|`EconomicEvent`) A commitment or economic event fully or partially satisfying an intent.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

satisfies.description: (`Intent`) An intent satisfied fully or partially by an economic event or commitment.

satisfiedBy.description: (`Commitment`|`EconomicEvent`) A commitment or economic event fully or partially satisfying an intent.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

startCursor.description: Cursor pointing to the first of the results returned, to be used with `before` query parameter if the backend supports reverse pagination.

endCursor.description: Cursor pointing to the last of the results returned, to be used with `after` query parameter if the backend supports forward pagination.

hasPreviousPage.description: True if there are more results before `startCursor`. If unable to be determined, implementations should return `true` to allow for requerying.

hasNextPage.description: True if there are more results after `endCursor`. If unable to be determined, implementations should return `true` to allow for requerying.

totalCount.description: The total result count, if it can be determined.

pageLimit.description: The number of items requested per page. Allows the storage backend to indicate this when it is responsible for setting a default and the client does not provide it. Note this may be different to the number of items returned, if there is less than 1 page of results.

AccountingScope.description: A boundary or context grouped around some other record- used for documenting, accounting, planning.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an agent. Does not imply uniqueness.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the agent, such as a logo, avatar, photo, etc.

primaryLocation.description: The main place an agent is located, often an address where activities occur and mail can be sent. This is usually a mappable geographic location.  It also could be a website address, as in the case of agents who have no physical location.

Agent.description: A person or group or organization with economic agency.

name.description: The name that this agent will be referred to by.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the agent, such as a logo, avatar, photo, etc.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

primaryLocation.description: The main place an agent is located, often an address where activities occur and mail can be sent. This is usually a mappable geographic location.  It also could be a website address, as in the case of agents who have no physical location.

name.description: The name that this agent will be referred to by.

image.description: The uri to an image relevant to the agent, such as a logo, avatar, photo, etc.

classifiedAs.description: References one or more concepts in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

primaryLocation.description: The main place an agent is located, often an address where activities occur and mail can be sent. This is usually a mappable geographic location.  It also could be a website address, as in the case of agents who have no physical location.

Organization.description: A formal or informal group, or legal organization.

subject.description: The subject of a relationship between 2 agents.  For example, if Mary is a member of a group, then Mary is the subject.

object.description: The object of a relationship between 2 agents.  For example, if Mary is a member of a group, then the group is the object.

relationship.description: A kind of relationship that exists between 2 agents.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

AgentRelationship.description: The role of an economic relationship that exists between 2 agents, such as member, trading partner.

roleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, from the subject to the object.

inverseRoleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, from the object to the subject.

AgentRelationshipRole.description: A relationship role defining the kind of association one agent can have with another.

roleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, inverse from the object to the subject. For example, 'is member of'.

inverseRoleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, inverse from the object to the subject. For example, 'has member'.

roleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, inverse from the object to the subject. For example, 'is member of'.

inverseRoleLabel.description: The human readable name of the role, inverse from the object to the subject. For example, 'has member'.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an agreement. Does not imply uniqueness.

created.description: The date and time the agreement was created.

Agreement.description: Any type of agreement among economic agents.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an agreement. Does not imply uniqueness.

created.description: The date and time the agreement was created.

name.description: An informal or formal textual identifier for an agreement. Does not imply uniqueness.

created.description: The date and time the agreement was created.

previousRevision.description: Metadata about the previous revision of this record, queryable via `revision(previousRevision.id)`. If this is the first revision of a record, this field is empty.

previousRevisionsCount.description: Number of older revisions, if known.

futureRevisionsCount.description: Number of newer revisions, if known.

latestRevision.description: Metadata regarding the most recent revision of this record, if able to be determined.

retrievedRevision.description: Metadata regarding the requested revision of this record. A record's `retrievedRevision.id` == `revisionId`.

id.description: ID of the revision, used to query a specific version of the related record.

time.description: Time this revision was created, if known.

author.description: The authoring `Agent` who created this revision.

action.description: Relates a claim to a verb, such as consume, produce, work, improve, etc.

resourceClassifiedAs.description: References a concept in a common taxonomy or other classification scheme for purposes of categorization or grouping.

resourceQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the economic resource counted or inventoried.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

triggeredBy.description: The economic event which already occurred which this claim has been made against.

due.description: The time the claim is expected to be settled.

created.description: The data on which the claim was made.

finished.description: The claim is complete or not.  This is irrespective of if the original goal has been met, and indicates that no more will be done.

agreedIn.description: Reference to an agreement between agents which specifies the rules or policies or calculations which govern this claim.

provider.description: The economic agent from whom the claim is expected.

receiver.description: The economic agent whom the claim is for.

inScopeOf.description: Grouping around something to create a boundary or context, used for documenting, accounting, planning.

resourceConformsTo.description: The primary resource specification or definition of an existing or potential economic resource. A resource will have only one, as this specifies exactly what the resource is.

Claim.description: A claim for a future economic event(s) in reciprocity for an economic event that already occurred. For example, a claim for payment for goods received.

settles.description: A claim which is fully or partially settled by an economic event.

settledBy.description: The economic event fully or partially settling a claim.

effortQuantity.description: The amount and unit of the work or use or citation effort-based action. This is often a time duration, but also could be cycle counts or other measures of effort or usefulness.

Settlement.description: Represents many-to-many relationships between claim and economic events that fully or partially settle one or more claims.

ResourceSpecification.description:
Specification of a kind of resource. Could define a material item, service, digital item, currency account, etc.
Used instead of a classification when more information is needed, particularly for recipes.

URI.title: URI
URI.description: The `URI` type simply declares a reference to an external web URL, Holochain entry or other resource.

DateTime.title: DateTime
DateTime.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime value as specified by
[ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

Decimal.title: Decimal
Decimal.description:
The `Decimal` scalar type represents arbitrary-precision floating-point
numbers as specified by
[IEEE 854-1987](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_854-1987).  They
are represented as strings.

label.description: A unique verb which defines the action.

resourceEffect.description: The accounting effect of an economic event on a resource, increment, decrement, no effect, or decrement resource and increment 'to' resource.

onhandEffect.description: The onhand effect of an economic event on a resource, increment, decrement, no effect, or decrement resource and increment 'to' resource.

inputOutput.description: Denotes if a process input or output, or not related to a process.

pairsWith.description: The action that should be included on the other direction of the process, for example accept with modify.

Action.description:
An action verb defining the kind of event, commitment, or intent.
It is recommended that the lowercase action verb should be used as the record ID
in order that references to `Action`s elsewhere in the system are easily readable.

AgentCommitmentFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Commitment`s related to an `Agent`

AgentIntentFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Intent`s related to an `Agent`

proposedTo.description: The agent to which the proposal is published.

proposed.description: The proposal that is published to a specific agent.

ProposedTo.description: An agent to which the proposal is to be published.  A proposal can be published to many agents.

AgentProcessFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Process`es related to an `Agent`

fulfills.description: Match Fulfillments fulfilling any of the given Commitments

fulfilledBy.description: Match Fulfillments fulfilled by any of the given EconomicEvents

satisfies.description: Match Satisfactions satisfying any of the given Intents

satisfiedBy.description: Match Satisfactions satisfied by any of the given EconomicEvents or Commitments

AgentEventFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `EconomicEvent`s related to an `Agent`

AgentResourceFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `EconomicResource`s related to an `Agent`

agentProposalSearchParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Proposal`s related to an `Agent`

PlanProcessFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Process`es related to a `Plan`

AgentPlanFilterParams.description: Query parameters for reading `Plan`s related to an `Agent`

classifiedAs.description: Retrieve only agents with the specified classification(s).

roleId.description: Retrieve only relationships matching these AgentRelationshipRole(s).

inScopeOf.description: Retrieve only relationships relevant in the given accounting scope(s).
